abstract: Piers Morgan, best known for his role as a judge on NBC’s “America’s Got Talent,” became the seventh winner of NBC’s “Apprentice” series on Thursday as the show’s two-hour finale earned the night’s highest ratings. According to Nielsen’s estimates, 12.1 million viewers tuned in from 9 to 11 p.m. for the “Apprentice” conclusion, the largest audience for any episode of the series since the finale of “The Apprentice 4″ in December 2005.
lead_paragraph: Piers Morgan, best known for his role as a judge on NBC’s “America’s Got Talent,” became the seventh winner of NBC’s “Apprentice” series on Thursday as the show’s two-hour finale earned the night’s highest ratings. According to Nielsen’s estimates, 12.1 million viewers tuned in from 9 to 11 p.m. for the “Apprentice” conclusion, the largest audience for any episode of the series since the finale of “The Apprentice 4″ in December 2005.

headline.main: Ratings: A Revived ‘Apprentice’ Finale Wins Out
